oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Men; Soldiers
United States - History - Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee - History - Civil War, 1861-1865; Arrangers (Musicians)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Bust portrait of W. R. McQuown in civilian clothing. An inscription beneath the image reads, "4th Ky. Regt., C.S.A./ Col. Lewis Regt./ W. R. McQuown." An inscription on the back reads, "Leader of the 4th Ky. Regt and the 1st Tenn Band until the surrender in 1865. First cousin of Geo. S. Nichols."
W. R. McQuown was a mid-19th century composer best known for the "Cadet's March," which he dedicated to the Kentucky State Guard.
